Note: Value for this key is defined in Localizable.stringsdict, not Localizable.strings. || Note: The core idea that we want to convey here is that, from now on, the button is being 'intercepted' by Mac Mouse Fix. We used the word 'capture' instead of 'intercept' since it sounds friendlier in English. In your language, you might want to use something closer to 'intercept'.

First draft: Spaces & Mission Control

trans-unit.source:
Move your mouse: - Up to show Mission Control - Down to show Application Windows - Left or Right to move between Spaces
Works like swiping with 3 fingers on an Apple Trackpad
trans-unit.target:
Move your mouse: - Up to show Mission Control - Down to show Application Windows - Left or Right to move between Spaces
Works like swiping with 3 fingers on an Apple Trackpad
trans-unit.note:
First draft: Move your mouse: - Up to show Mission Control - Down to show Application Windows - Left or Right to move between Spaces
Works like swiping with 3 fingers on an Apple Trackpad
First draft: Scroll & Navigate

trans-unit.source:
Scroll freely by moving your mouse in any direction
Also Navigate between pages in Safari, delete messages in Mail and more by moving your mouse left and right
Works like swiping with 2 fingers on an Apple Trackpad
trans-unit.target:
Scroll freely by moving your mouse in any direction
Also Navigate between pages in Safari, delete messages in Mail and more by moving your mouse left and right
Works like swiping with 2 fingers on an Apple Trackpad

Also Navigate between pages in Safari, delete messages in Mail and more by moving your mouse left and right

trans-unit.source:
Mac Mouse Fix was **disabled** in System Settings
To enable Mac Mouse Fix:
1. Go to [Login Items Settings](x-apple.systempreferences:com.apple.LoginItems-Settings.extension) 2. Switch on 'Mac Mouse Fix.app'
trans-unit.target:
Mac Mouse Fix was **disabled** in System Settings
To enable Mac Mouse Fix:
1. Go to [Login Items Settings](x-apple.systempreferences:com.apple.LoginItems-Settings.extension) 2. Switch on 'Mac Mouse Fix.app'
trans-unit.note:
First draft: Mac Mouse Fix was **disabled** in System Settings
To enable Mac Mouse Fix:
1. Go to [Login Items Settings](x-apple.systempreferences:com.apple.LoginItems-Settings.extension) 2. Switch on 'Mac Mouse Fix.app'

trans-unit.source:
Mac Mouse Fix can't be enabled because there's __another version__ of Mac Mouse Fix present on your computer
To enable Mac Mouse Fix:
1. Delete the [other version](%@) 2. Empty the Bin 3. Restart your Mac 4. Try again!
trans-unit.target:
Mac Mouse Fix can't be enabled because there's __another version__ of Mac Mouse Fix present on your computer
To enable Mac Mouse Fix:
1. Delete the [other version](%@) 2. Empty the Bin 3. Restart your Mac 4. Try again!

First draft: Mac Mouse Fix can't be enabled because there's __another version__ of Mac Mouse Fix present on your computer

1. Delete the [other version](%@) 2. Empty the Bin 3. Restart your Mac 4. Try again!

trans-unit.source:
This license has been activated **%d** times. The maximum is **%d**.
Because of this, the license has been invalidated. This is to prevent piracy. If you have other reasons for activating the license this many times, please excuse the inconvenience.
Just [reach out](mailto:noah.n.public@gmail.com) and I will provide you with a new license! Thanks for understanding.

First draft: Click %@ || Note: %@ will be a button name || Example where %@ is 'Button 5': ⌥⌘ Double Click Button 4 + Click Button 5 || Note: Most of the substrings that are used to build the Action Table Trigger Strings (this is one of those substrings) are capitalized in English because it's common to use 'title case' there. In your language, 'title case' might not be a thing, and so you might not want to capitalize these strings. The first letter of the trigger string will be programmatically capitalized in any language.
First draft: Double Click %@
First draft: Triple Click %@

First draft: Drag || Note: This substring will be emphasized in drag trigger strings like 'Double Click and Drag %@'. Make sure that spelling and capitalization matches exactly for the emphasis to work.
First draft: Click and Drag %@ || Note: %@ will be a button name || example where %@ is 'Button 5': ⌥⌘ Triple Click Button 4 + Click and Drag Button 5
First draft: Double Click and Drag %@
First draft: Triple Click and Drag %@
First draft: and Drag || Note: This will be used for Drag Actions that only need keyboard modifiers to be activated - not mouse buttons || Example: ⌥⌘ and Drag
First draft: Hold %@
First draft: Double Click and Hold %@
First draft: Triple Click and Hold %@

First draft: Scroll || Note: This substring will be emphasized in scroll trigger strings like 'Triple Click and Scroll %@'. Make sure that spelling and capitalization matches exactly for the emphasis to work.
First draft: Click and Scroll %@
First draft: Double Click and Scroll %@
First draft: Triple Click and Scroll %@
First draft: and Scroll || Example: ⌥⌘ and Scroll
